posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
HotU is made for characters who have finished SoU, not the OC. It is best to plan out your build before you start playing, and you can do this if you start your second track in SoU.

I never play evil, so I have no experience with BG, so I can't help you with the build. I tried playing an evil character in the OC once, with a Rogue 8 / Fighter 12 build, but I didn't even finish the Peninsula District in Chapter One because I just couldn't stomach being so evil.

Empyre65 wrote:HotU is made for characters who have finished SoU, not the OC. It is best to plan out your build before you start playing, and you can do this if you start your second track in SoU.
I know - I just don't like SOU. One of my greatest playing experiences, however, was a PAL/COT I started in SOU, took through HOTU and then some high-level user modules. PAL(10)COT(20) and a nearly perfect avatar of good!

For this phase of my NWN experience, however, I'm experimenting with "redeemed" characters - start them good, have them fall then come back to the light. Ultimately, I'm going to do a PAL/BG/COT so that I can actually use Aribeth's sword. Previously, I've used too many BG levels so I'm tryingba level 4 BG to get the feel.

posts.content:
On a tangent, if you haven't played the Sands of Fate series, you should because you would enjoy it. It is perfect for a character who has finished HotU, and it will take your character all the way to level 40. I also highly recommend The Aielund Saga, which starts at level 1 and goes to about level 36. Both series can easily be found in the Vault.
One of these days, I have got to try that Aribeth series. Would a Neutral Good Bard / Fighter / RDD work alright there? How about a Lawful Good Rogue / Monk / Fighter?
